Desde los años  80, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos; esta actividad la aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que en una ocasión compro un cerdo lo engordo y luego lo quiso vender y como no se lo pagaron bien lo destazo  noto que le quedo mucha ganancia. Ella compra cerdos y ganado para la crianza y para el destazo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una res para destazarla. Podrá seguir con la rutina de destazo los días sábados ya que no cuenta con todo el dinero para comprar el animal. Cada día cambia la situación económica de la familia ya que con el trabajo obtiene las ganancias para salir adelante.

Pretende seguir con el negocio; para que no le falte el sustento a su familia y tampoco el estudio de sus últimos dos hijos.
texts.en:
María is 67 years old and married. Since the 80's she has raised pigs. She learned this activity on her own initiative. She bought a pig, fattened it up and when she tried to sell it, they didn't want to pay her very much, so she butchered it herself and made a good profit. She buys pigs and cattle to raise and butcher. 

She is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy a cow to butcher. She will be able to continue with the routine of butchering on Saturdays, because she doesn't have all of the money to buy the animal herself. Everyday her family's financial situation changes, because with her work she makes profits to get ahead.   .

She intends to continue in her business so that her family won't lack support and her youngest children will have an education.

loans.use: to buy a cow to butcher.

loans.name: Angel Leonidas

texts.es: El Sr. Ángel tiene 25 años sigue con el servicio de servicio de amplificación cuenta que le fue bien con los anteriores créditos ya que está creciendo y mejorando su amplificación y esto le permite tener más contratos para amenizar distintas actividades sociales  ya que el brinda un buen servicio, El Sr. Ángel va a usar este préstamo para compra de una consola por su negocio ya que todas sus ganancias lo invierte en compra de luces y demás equipos que le hacen falta.
texts.en: Ángel is 25 years old. He continues to have his sound system service. He says that the pervious loans worked out well for him, since he is growing and improving his sound system and this allows him to have more contracts to animate different social activities, because he offers a good service. Ángel is going to use this loan to buy a console for his business, since he invests all of his profits in buying lights and more equipment that he needs.

loans.use: to buy a console.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is an Egyptian Albanian. Surprisingly he hasn’t followed the footsteps of other members of his ethnic community whose talents often include buying-selling and ironwork. Ten years ago, when he was 22 years old, he relocated from the city to a village in an attempt to live a different life from the rest of his community. 

“I liked the nature and everything else in it, so as soon as I relocated to the village I felt so good and at peace as well. I also felt then that I had left behind the stigma that had surrounded us for generations. I felt free. There is no such stigma now; everyone lives peacefully here and in harmony with one another. This is after the collapse of the communist era,” Vladimir said.

Vladimir is married and has three children, ages 7, 5, and 3. For the past ten years, he has been in the livestock and construction industries.  He now wants to add some more goats to the existing herd. This will be his third loan; the previous ones have been paid off.

loans.use: To buy goats to add to his herd

loans.name: Tsetserleg

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetserleg, 53 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a wooden house on a plot of land. Ten years ago, the family moved from the countryside to Ulaanbaatar in hopes of improving their lives. She immediately began her business selling shoes; she has been running it for ten years. Her husband pushes a carriage around the market in order to deliver goods to customers. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, she can repair and insulate her house, providing a comfortable and warm place for her family. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, releasing fewer pollutants into the air and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Mrs. Tsetserleg is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 60 years old and from Nakuru. She has a business selling chickens, a business she has been running for the past 20 years. She repaid her previous loan on time and has applied for her third loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to complete the construction of her rental houses. She earns an average monthly income of 50,000 KES.

She hopes to see her business grow to great heights in the near future.

loans.use: To complete the construction of rental houses.

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en: Abdel Karim is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man. He owns a tractor which he uses to carry water to houses whenever they are out of water. He also provides farmers with the needed quantity of water so as to ease their crops growing process. With his youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will perform the needed maintenance on his tractor to be able to keep on performing his work with high professionalism.  Abdel Karim is very positive and we note that this will be his first Kiva loan and he is sure that it will help him achieve remarkable growth in a short term.

loans.use: perform the needed maintenance on his tractor

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 36 years old, married to Michael, and they have three children aged 15, 9 and 6 years. While Michael is in formal employment, Victoria is in a farming business which she has practiced for the past three years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET ltd to enable her to buy fertilizers and wheat seeds. 

With the anticipated profits, Victoria hopes to expand her farming business. In the near future, Victoria wants to grow her farming business so as to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Ylber

texts.en:
Ylber is requesting a loan for the first time to add more goats from a good breed to his existing herd. In the past five years, he has been selling dairy products from his goats and fresh produce harvested from the field at the local market.

Ylber is a villager who lives in south-central Albania. He does construction work in addition to his livestock/agricultural activity. “I’ve got to work. I’ve three children to feed and educate, but thank God we are doing fine. I don’t like complaining. I am forty-three years old and have still time and energy to accomplish my goals. I would like to have one hundred goats and I am working towards it.“

loans.use: To add more goats to the existing herd

loans.name: Al Saiid Group

texts.en:
Amira is the featured borrower of Al Saiid Group. She is the second from the left. She came together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

She is a 56-year-old married mother of two children. She works in preparing and selling Mouneh (preserving food for future use) which is a highly requested service in her region. She is a hard worker with excellent experience in her domain, as she has twelve years in preserving food and preparing distilled flavored water.

Amira applied for a loan that will be invested in buying the present season's products to be preserved for the coming seasons. She will also use part of her loan for her son's wedding preparations.

As for the other group members, Jina is the second from the right, Samira is the one wearing a yellow top, and Hanine is the first on the left.

loans.use: to buy this season's produce to be preserved for the coming seasons.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 28-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working in her convenience store for two years to help her husband cover their family's expenses. Both of her children are enrolled in a private school and they want to make sure their children will have the best education ever.
Jamila's husband works but with a very low income and she is a good support to him.
 
She is applying for her second loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to acquire a YOUTH loan that will increase her business merchandise with special Summer and Holy Ramadan month items (cold beverages, dried fruits and dates).

This loan will support her business just like the previous one which had a very positive impact on her family's socioeconomic situation.

She hopes to expand her business and diversify her products.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with special summer and Holy Ramadan month items

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is the married mother of three children, who attend school. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, Fatuma has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer from Naivasha and is married to Elizabeth. He has been in his farming business for the past six years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET ltd to enable him to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor. He paid his previous loan on time. 

He intends to educate his children by paying their school fees with the anticipated profit. In the near future, Daniel hopes to expand his farming business to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married and has seven children. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She operates a business of selling eggs at the market, selling to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase 9 crates of eggs and packing papers for the sale of the eggs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 9 crates of eggs and packing papers for sale of the eggs.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is a 37 year old married woman and has provided recycling services for many years. She buys plastic bottles that contained Pepsi, Coke, Mirinda (500 ml, 1 ltr, 1.5 ltr, and 2.25 ltr) and other beverages that would otherwise be trash. After proper crushing and recycling she sells them back to the people of her community. Through her business she makes enough income to contribute to her family's livelihood. 

She has five children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with Kashf foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 35000 to buy more bottles in different sizes to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy bottles in different sizes.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
At the age of 23 Humaira is an energetic married lady and the mother of two children.  She has been stitching clothes for the past two years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from the Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan to buy spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will create a means of increasing her revenue so that she can generate more income. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase welding equipment

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 36-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has operated a snack bar since 2011 and has more than 10 years of experience working in the same field. His store is adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbours and members of the local community. 

To help him continue operating his business, Elias is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He will utilize the loan to buy raw supplies and machinery to make french fries, which he needs to continue production and expand his product inventory. 

He expects a minimum increase of 15 per cent in his business income, with which he will start thinking about expanding his business into other areas.

loans.use: to buy raw supplies and machinery for making french fries

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has been working in the construction field for the past 5 years. In 2011, he started to work independently, responding promptly to any request he receives. He specializes in installing bricks over buildings. His work is very tough and he must work very carefully to end up with a good quality result. 

Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a welding generator for his business. He states that the generator will mainly facilitate his tasks. In the future, he plans to open his own office and enlarge his operations by dealing with multiple construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a welding generator for his business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old and married with four children who are in school. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past five years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET ltd to enable him to buy a motorbike.

In the near future, David hopes to venture into large scale farming with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is a widow from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she has been running a general store selling a variety of goods for many years. Aside from this business, she also operates a service-based business, providing motor transportation and rental services in her community. 

Recently, she borrowed 5,000 PHP to cover the cost of renewing a motorcycle registration. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to cover the cost of renewing a motor registration.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 45 years old, married to Benson, and they have three children who are in school. She is a farmer from Olkalau, and after successfully paying back her previous loan, she has applied for her third loan from KADET ltd to enable her to pay school fees.

In the near future, Lucy hopes to see her children consistently educated as well as to grow her dairy farming so as to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Eucabeth

texts.en:
Eucabeth is 32 years old, married, and a mother of three children, ages 14, 11, and 8 years old. She is a potato farmer and also operates a green grocery store.

She learned about KADET from some other farmers in her area. This will be her second loan after successfully repaying the previous one. The funds will be used to facilitate her harvesting process as well as to pay for transportation of the produce to the market.

The proceeds will be used to expand her grocery store. Her plan is to turn her business into a highly profitable venture hence creating job opportunities for others.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been actively involved in the business of clothing sales with the support of her husband for three years. Her husband buys clothing of different designs in bulk from the market at lower rates, and then she sells them in her community at reasonable prices. She has a good client list, and most of her clients are her neighbors. 

She is mother of three children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands of life through her business. In order to expand her business she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs for the summer season so that she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without delay. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs for the summer season.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, she has three children, and she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Martha Maria Diocelina

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 63 años, creció en el campo con su familia en donde su padre siempre la hacía participar y ayudar en el negocio de la familia en el mercado local. Martha se casó muy joven, matrimonio del cual nacieron su hijos a quienes después de una dura pero inevitable separación, tuvo que educarlos sola a veces negándose el sustento para sí misma, pero su esfuerzo valió la pena, pues sus hijos son independientes y lo aprendido lo han puesto en práctica para desenvolverse en su caminar. Cuando Martha se casó, se trasladó a Quito la capital de los ecuatorianos, en donde actualmente vive con una de sus hijas, específicamente en el barrio llamado “Chillogallo” ubicado al sur de la ciudad, sector que hasta hace pocos años no era tomado en cuenta dentro de los sectores económicos fuertes de la capital de la República del Ecuador, ahora este sector es considerado una fuerza de la economía de la ciudad. En este lugar se encuentran familias emprendedoras que han luchado para sobresalir. Entre nativos y migrantes de otras ciudades y países, ha sido el punto de encuentro de habitantes de varias provincias, y está reconstruido con extensas calles, un sector en el cual su alta actividad comercial es cada vez más fortalecida y aporta en gran manera al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. Se destaca en esta zona los parques con amplias zonas verdes en los cuales se dan cita las familias los fines de semana. Hay gran accesibilidad a todo tipo de servicios y sus habitantes son emprendedores que aprovechan cada oportunidad que se presenta con establecimiento de nuevos negocios.
Martha siempre se ha dedicado a la comercialización de frutas y verduras, sin embargo hace 5 años encontró un lugar en el mercado local, en donde va a ofertar sus productos los días de feria es decir martes, viernes y sábado. Esto ha incrementado sus ventas pero ha demandado de ella un mayor esfuerzo, pues a su edad el traslado de los bultos llenos de frutas y verduras, es más complicados de trasladarse, pues ella debe tener un especial cuidado por el tema de su salud. Martha utiliza los conocimientos obtenidos de su preparación primaria para llevar a cabo su negocio. Invierte cada día varias horas para hacer los pedidos respectivos a sus proveedores y hacer las ventas respectivas y mucho tiempo más en los días de feria. En los últimos días ha percibido una falta de variedad en sus productos, pues muchos de sus clientes tienen que completar su canasta en otros puestos del mercado. Por esta razón, Martha ha solicitado un préstamo con el fin de invertir en nuevos productos y así ampliar su negocio, además así podría obtener el dinero adicional tener un lugar más grande dentro del mercado. Martha afirma que muchas veces este sueño no pudo ser posible por la falta de capital y además por la dificultad y obstáculos que ponen las instituciones financieras, por el contrario Martha encontró en Fundación Alternativa el apoyo para su microempresa, de tal forma que se sintió importante tanto para su ejecutivo de cuenta como para la entidad.  Ella estuvo de acuerdo en aplicar al producto de Kiva para que así también pueda sentir el apoyo de varias personas alrededor del mundo que todavía creen en los sueños y esfuerzo de las personas del sector “micro”.
texts.en:
Martha is a 63-year-old woman. She grew up in the country with her family. Her father always made her participate and help in the family business in the local market. Martha married very young, and from her marriage came her children, who are now independent of her after a difficult but inevitable parting. She had to educate them by herself and sometimes did not have enough to eat, but her effort was worth it and they have learnt to fend for themselves. When Martha married, she moved to Quito, the capital of Ecuador, and she currently lives there with one of her daughters in the neighbourhood called “Chillogallo” in the southern part of the city. This area was not counted among the strong economic areas of the capital of the Republic of Ecuador until recently, but it is now considered an economic force in the capital. It is here that you can find enterprising families who have fought to get ahead. It has been the meeting point between inhabitants of various provinces, natives, and immigrants from other cities and countries. It has been rebuilt to have wide streets. The high commercial activity of this area is constantly strengthening and it contributes greatly to the economic growth of the city. There are also large parks in this zone, where families meet during the weekend. There is great accessibility to all types of services and the inhabitants are enterprising and take every opportunity that presents itself to establish new businesses.

Martha has always made a living by selling fruit and vegetables; however, five years ago she found a place in a local market, where she sells her produce on market days (Tuesday, Friday, and Saturday). This has increased her sales but it requires more effort on her part. At her age transporting the packages full of fruit and vegetables is more complicated, and she must take special care of her health. Martha uses the knowledge she learnt in primary school to run her business. She invests several hours each day in making orders to her suppliers and making sales, and more time on market days. She has recently noticed a lack of variety in her produce and that many of her clients have to complete their shopping at other stalls in the market. For this reason, Martha has requested a loan with the goal of investing in new products and expanding her business, thereby enabling her to obtain additional money in order to get a larger place in the market. Martha states that many times this dream was not possible due to the lack of capital and because of the difficulties and obstacles financial institutions put in place. With Fundación Alternativa, Martha found the support for her microbusiness in such a way that she felt important for both being the account executor and to the entity. She agreed to apply to Kiva so that she could also feel the support of various people around the world who still believe in the dreams and efforts of people in the “micro” sector.

loans.use: to expand her food stall

loans.name: Phina

texts.en:
Phina is a widow with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Phina operates a business selling cereal. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. The major challenge to the success of her business is seasonality. Phina's dream is to establish a wholesale cereals business in the near future. 

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), Phina wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been actively involved in the business of making artificial jewelry for five years. She makes jewelry with stones and pearls then sells them in the market at higher rates. She counts a good client list and manages her household expenses with the income from her business. She has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy dozens of gold and silver jewelry supplies with some packs of artificial stones and pearls in various colors. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. She hopes to have a good experience with the new loan and expects a boost in her earnings through higher sales.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver jewelry supplies plus artificial stones and pearls

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Benkadi 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Aminata (femme assise au bout à droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Fabougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Benkadi 1 group are all married and live in traditional families. They, on average, are 40 years old and have two children. They all live in Fabougou in the Segou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other from their farming in the rainy season as well as neighborhood, marriage, and kinship ties. 

The group members grow groundnuts, millet, and rice. With the goal of buying small farm equipment and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their second loan cycle of the season.

Aminata (the woman seated in front on the right in the photo) leads the farming during the rainy season in Fabougou. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers. She also will [pay someone to] plow the field and then [also] pay some young people to weed it.

The sales of the crops for cash at the end of the rainy season will be used to pay back her loan and to support her children and a part of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Cesar Vallejo De V.e.s Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 mujeres  emprendedoras    y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “CESAR VALLEJO V.E.S”. Mónica  de 43 años de edad soltera  Y sin  hijos, ella se dedica hace 3 años  a la venta de ropa usada en un pequeño mercado con la idea de salir adelante, Mónica nos cuenta que con mucho empeño y trabajo  ah ido generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un pequeño local   propio donde poder vender su ropa  y así  tener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropa y así poder tener más ingresos económicos. A la vez  Mónica y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Mónica se encuentra sentada es la primera de la mano izquierda, se le distingue  con un saco manga larga de color verde con rayas cuadradas,se despide Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: A group comprised of eight enterprising women with a great deal of creativity for business - such are the members of the "Cesar Vallejo V.E.S." communal bank. Mónica is 43 years old and single, and doesn't have any children. For the past three years she has been selling used clothing in a small market with the goal of getting ahead. Mónica reports that with a great deal of effort and hard work she has generated profits in order to afford her household expenses. In the future she'd like to own a small store of her own where she can sell her garments, and thus increase her profits. With the loan she obtained she'll purchase more clothing and therefore she'll be able to improve her earnings. At the same time, Mónica and all the members are grateful towards Kiva for the loan they obtained and for the trust that has been bestowed upon them. Mónica is sitting down, the first one from the left. She's seen wearing a long-sleeved green coat with stripes that form a squared pattern. She bids goodbye and promises that she'll accomplish all the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Concepcion

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 34 años de edad, es habitante de una comarca llamada Los Andino, una zona marginal de Managua, es casada su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad, aun no tienen hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne de res, esta es su manera de ganarse la vida, junto con su esposo comparte los gastos y buscan como progresar. Esta es su primera experiencia crediticia para Rosa, necesita invertir más en su negocio para mantener las ventas que le dan el pan de cada día.
texts.en: Rosa is 34 years old and she lives in a region called Los Andino, a zone of Managua. She is married and her husband works as a security guard. They don't yet have any children. She sells cuts of beef as a way to earn a living and she shares all the costs that she and her husband have. They are both looking for ways to advance in life. This is her first experience with micro-finance loans and she needs to invest more in her business in order to keeps sales up so she can buy her daily bread.

loans.use: invest in cuts of beef.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 38-year-old energetic married mother. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years and demand for her work is strong because she is zealous with her craft. Ruqia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the highest income earner in her household. However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Ruquia is a mother of two children and must provide them with the basic necessities of life. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy large quantities of raw materials, such as threads, sequins and pearls, to meet the increasing demand. Her dream is to open her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of embroidery materials such as threads, sequins and pearls

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Benkadi 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Maissata (femme assise au bout à droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Fabougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Benkadi 3 group are married and live in traditional families. They, on average, are 38 years old and have three children. They all live in Fabougou in the region of Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other from their farming in the rainy season and through neighborhood, marriage, and family ties. 

This group grow groundnuts, millet, and rice. With the goal of buying small pieces of equipment and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan cycle of the season. 

Maissata (the women seated in the front on the right in the photo) leads the farming during the rainy season in Fabougou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to pay some young people to weed her field. 

Sales of the crops for cash at the end of the rainy season will be used to pay back her loan and to support her children and a part of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 44-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a farmer for the past 13 years. His job consists in cultivating vegetables. In addition, and during his free time, he has worked as a fisherman for the past 20 years and he enjoys this hobby to the max. His wife works as well to supplement the family’s income. 

Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and implement a water station to well irrigate the crops. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his business productivity by a large percentage which will return higher profits to him. In the future, he plans to open a vegetable shop and start selling his own harvested goods.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and implement a water station

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old and married to Aktela. A farmer from Nyahururu, she has applied for her second loan from the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. 

Nancy has been in the farming business for the past four years. In the near future, she hopes to expand her farming and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 35-year-old married man. He is blessed with 5 children and his wife operates a retail shop. George on the other hand operates a clothing shop in Enaibelbel area, Narok. He has been running this business for the past 5 years earning a monthly income of KES 15000.
He has borrowed a fifth loan of KES 50000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase more clothing for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for his school-going children.
His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Ntalama

texts.en: Ntalama is 41 years old, married to Simaloi, and blessed with eight children. Ntalama has been in the agriculture  business for the last three years with the monthly income of KES 30,000. Ntalama has qualified to get his third loan from KADET Limited of KES 60,000 which he will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers. The anticipated profit from his expanded business will be used to buy another piece of land for farming. Ntalama's hopes and dreams for his future business are to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald, 31, is a single entrepreneur in Gango, Ozamis City, who makes money raising hogs. He started this business more than two years ago and earns 4,000 Philippine pesos a month. 

Recently, he requested a new loan to buy feeds and piglets to raise. He plans to expand his piggery to gain more income for his future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets to raise

loans.name: Ghulam  Sakeena

texts.en:
Ghulam Sakeena is a 38-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 51 years old, married and has six children. She is in the business of pig fattening in the town of Dumaguete in the Philippines. She has requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Liliosa has been in this business for 15 years now, and has taken out five previous loans from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en:
Kaniz is a 30-year-old married woman who is a very talented lady and excels in her sewing business. She sews for the people of her community and has received a lot of appreciation from her customers. She has accepted the fact that if her husband was the sole income earner in the family, they would not be able to meet the expenses of their household. Thus, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Kaniz has requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. Using these, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand for her work. She expects this will boost her earnings and she wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more reels of thread and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs such as maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 28 años de edad, tiene un hijo. él tiene más de 15 años de practicar el arte de la agricultura, dicha actividad es la única que le genera ingresos todo este tiempo, además de tener al cuidado uno de los hermanos menores al cual pues le están heredando los conocimientos que él tiene en el trabajo de la agricultura. Marcelino, es muy reconocido en la comunidad como un muchacho responsable y de buenos valores.  

Compra los materiales en la ciudad, por lo cual tiene que desplazarse más de 54 kilómetros, distancia que recorre en el transporte colectivo de la comunidad un transporte que pasa por la comunidad 4 veces durante la trayectoria del día muchas veces estos autobuses no salen y cuesta mucho movilizarse hacia la ciudad, ya que es cliente frecuente y le dan precios a la hora de adquirir los insumos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas, pagar la limpia del terreno para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

Una de las primeras necesidades en satisfacer es la obtención de ingresos a la familia la cual prácticamente solo depende de esta actividad.  Además de asegurar un ingreso mensual después de la venta de la cosecha. 
Desea mejorar la estabilidad económica y alimenticia de la familia a parte de brindar trabajo a los miembros de la misma familia ya que es una actividad productiva que los une como familia, también mejorara la calidad de vida y una mayor obtención de ingresos. 

Su deseo es brindar un mejor estudio a su hermano menor ; ya que  desea que se supere en los estudios, pues no tuvo esta oportunidad, además de poder comprar ganado en el futuro y poder mantenerse de esta actividad ganadera, al igual sueña con un hogar estable y con las suficiente comodidades para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 28 years old and has a son. He has practiced the art of agriculture for over 15 years. This line of work has been his only source of income through all this time. In addition, he looks after one of his younger brothers who has been inheriting his knowledge of farming work. Marcelino is very well-known in his community as a responsible young man with good moral values.

He buys his supplies in town, and for that he has to travel more than 54 kilometers. He covers this distance on the community's collective transport, a means of transportation that drives through the community four times during the day. A lot of times these buses don't come out and it's very costly for him to commute into the town. He's a regular customer and gets the prices at the moment of buying the supplies.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación is to purchase fertilizer, compost, pesticide and herbicide, and to pay for the cleaning of the field so he can grow 7,000 square meters of corn.

One of the primary needs he has to satisfy is obtaining profits for his family, who depends almost exclusively on this business. Besides, he has to ensure a monthly income after selling the harvest.
He wishes to improve his family's diet and financial stability, and also provide work for the members of his family, since it's a business that brings them together as a family. He'll also improve his living conditions and turn a higher profit.

His wish is to provide better education for his younger brother. He wishes that he'll succeed in his studies, because he didn't have that opportunity himself. In addition, in the future he wishes to be able to buy cattle and get his livelihood from this cattle business. Also, he dreams of having a stable home with enough conveniences for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, pesticide and herbicide, and to pay for the cleaning of the field so he can grow 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of addition family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent for her stall at the market and school fees for her children.

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 2 1/2 years. She works at the market seven days out of every week and works on a retail basis only. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She is aspiring to sell wholesale and also to open up another stall selling used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years now.

Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 24-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has attracted many regular customers to her store. She makes enough money to provide for her family. 

In order to fully stock her store, Ghazala has requested a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at low prices. In this way she will be able to consistently meet increasing demand. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wishes to make use of part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour for her store

loans.name: Chindoro

texts.en:
Chindoro is a married mother with three school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She operates a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food kiosk operators in her business. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes de Benkadi 5 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33ans et 2enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Aminata (femme assise au milieu  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Fabougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members members of the Benkadi 5 group are all married women who live in traditional families.  They are, on average, 33 years old with two children each. They all reside in the village of Fabougou, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know one another through their seasonal farm work and also through neighborhood, marriage and family ties.  They grow groundnuts, millet and rice.

They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy small tools and farm inputs, and they are on their second farming loan.

Aminata (seated, in the middle of the group, in the photo) is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Fabougou.  She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to pay some young people for weeding.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Fikira

texts.en:
Fikira is married and lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For over one year, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a farming business that earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her businesses. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy 15 hens for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 hens for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile area for agricultural production. She has two children who are of school-going age. She has been farming for eight years. Her main sources of income are maize, cow peas, potatoes and beans. The challenge she faces is that of poor climatic conditions.

She has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for the purchase of a water tank for storing water for farming activities. This will boost production because of the regular flow of water to the farm. Her income base will increase and this will enable her to educate her children better and also improve their living standards.

In five years, she will have put up a green house to maximize production.

Hellen says that there has been an improvement in her farming practices as a result of the training received from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno has operated a retail shop business for years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist in paying for renovations and purchasing special equipment for a separate, professional kitchen.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 41, is doing a business of hand-embroidery with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Their designs are much in demand, and they have managed to consolidate a clientele that allows them to contribute to the expenses of their three children. 

Safia has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation, and she has shown good repayment behavior. Safia shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village where she can teach them the art of embroidery.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan is a 46-year-old man living in a little town in the southeastern part of Albania who is planning on getting married soon. “In Albania, people get married at a young age, in their twenties, but this rule did not apply to me, unfortunately” he said, laughing. “I feel that I am very ready now though to commit to a marriage,” he continued.

Six years ago, Artan started operating an internet café in his town. “Since then things have been going pretty good. There are no such places in the vicinity, but mine, so it has worked both ways, for me and the clientele as well,” Artan said. “While I wanted to add another floor to the existing one, for the moment, I just want to do some minor internal renovations,” he said.

Artan is requesting a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) for the first time; he wants to do some minor renovations to the inside of his internet café.

loans.use: to pay for minor renovations to the inside of his internet cafe

loans.name: Noelina

texts.en:
Noelina is married and has four children, and all her children go to school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has business of selling fish and has been in this business for years. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She generates additional income from part-time teaching and also selling used clothes. 

She has applied for loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. She is aspiring to sell fish wholesale and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Mavluddin

texts.en:
Mavluddin is 19 years old. He is hardworking and kind. Mavluddin is not married and lives with his parents. 

Mavluddin has been farming for two years, producing potatoes and other crops. His parents help him to manage the business. He has additional income from animal husbandry. 

In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, Mavluddin is currently requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizer and continue improving his crop production. He hopes to develop his business and from the profit improve living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for a piece of land where he grows potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Djantoyerela 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Djantoyerela 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Bounou. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Maimouna (1ère femme debout au bout à gauche  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Bounou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Djantoyerela 4 group are all married within traditional families. On average, they are 34 years old and have three children each. They all live in the village of Bounou, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farm work and also through neighborhood, marriage and family ties. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice.

They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy small tools and farm inputs, and they are on their second farming loan.

Maimouna (standing first from the left in the photo) is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Bounou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to hire some young people for weeding.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married mother with four school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food kiosk operators in her business. 

With KES 15,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding to her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda is a 63-year-old  married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. She is engaged in a fresh fish vending business.She sells fish to customers in the community. She has been selling fish for almost 10 years now. Alfreda  requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish to re-sell and provide revolving capital to allow her business to survive. In the future, Alfreda would like to expand her fish vending business to improve their livelihood and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to re-sell and provide revolving capital

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 44, deals in animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, raises them and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She is a dedicated mother of five and needs to improve her business to fulfill the basic necessities of her children.

 For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for three years and has shown good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
At the age of 26, Asma is an energetic married lady. She is a mother of two children and striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. She has been happily stitching clothes to support her family for two years.  She is very expert in stitching clothes according to fashion and has gotten a lot of appreciation from her customers. She manages her household while operating her business. 

Asma wants to expand her business and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors with some packs of buttons, laces and needles. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors with some packs of buttons, laces and needles.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 21-year-old single lady who has worked in selling clothes since a year ago. Her business is going just fine but she needs an external financial push to support it and diversify its products to respond better to customers' needs.

Hanan is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to start new perfumes and accessories selling sectors. These additional sectors will attract her customers' attention and increase her income. 

At the beginning she had problems while starting her business because she wasn't capable of finding a shop at the main road to attract foreign customers, but since a year ago her number of customers has been increasing because of her customer service and special reputation in her region.

She hopes to open in the future separate perfumes and accessories specialized shops and develop her business more and more in her region and the neighboring ones.

loans.use: to start new perfumes and accessories selling sectors.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes de Benkadi 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Hawa (femme assise au bout à droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Fabougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the Benkadi 4 group are all married within traditional families. On average, they are 38 years old and have three children each. They all live in the village of Fabougou, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farm work and also through neighborhood, marriage and family ties within the village. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice.

They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy small tools and farm inputs, and they are on their second farming loan.

Hawa (seated first from the right in the photo) is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Fabougou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to hire some young people for weeding.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Analyn is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analyn has a ready-to-wear business,buying and selling clothing in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy pants, T-shirts, slippers, bags, etc. to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for 10 years. Analyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, slippers, bags, etc.  to sell

loans.name: Bareen

texts.en:
Bareen, age 26, is a married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of clothing sales for some years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She enjoys good repute in her town due to her good quality fabrics and excellent dealing with her customers. 

Currently she accessed a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members such as her father. 

Rehema has had a tailoring business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 70,0000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to buy more rolls of dress making material. 

Rehema generates additional income through poultry farming. She sells wholesale seven days a week. The major challenges to her business are seasonality and defaulters. Rehema aspires to own a tailoring school. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. 

Rehema's monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of dress making material.

loans.name: Benkaditon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Benkaditon 1 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Menata (2ème femme arrêté de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Massalawere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter les petits équipements , s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Benkaditon 1 group are all married within traditional families. On average, they are 36 years old and have five children each. They all live in the village of Massalawere, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farm work and also through neighborhood, marriage and family ties within the village. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice.

They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy small tools and farm inputs, and they are on their second farming loan.

Menata (standing second from the left in the photo) is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Massalawere. She plans to use her loan to buy small tools, seeds and fertilizers, and then to hire some young people to weed her field. 

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 31-year-old married woman. One year ago, she started her own general store in her area to support her family very well. She offers various types of grocery items to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has become famous by providing good quality products and makes enough money to lead a decent life. As she wants to expand her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar and beverages in large quantities. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good loan history. With this new loan she would be able to generate more revenue that will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar and beverages in large quantities.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 26, deals in the business of stitching clothes. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is 49 years old and is from Jenin. He is married and has three children, one of whom attends primary school. Taleb has owned a grocery store since 2008 and has one employee who helps him.

Taleb asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods and drinks for his grocery store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and thus improve his sales and income, which will help him provide his children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy goods and drinks for his grocery store

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon who lives with his wife and only child. He has owned a car repair shop since 2011. 

Imad's job consists of repairing cars, both inside and outside. He works very hard to support his family and recently, he hired a part-time employee to help him complete the work. 

With Imad's requested youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, he will increase his shop’s inventory of mechanical tools and supplies such as oils, screw-drivers, hummers etc.

In the future, Imad plans to open a new branch of his shop, where he will sell spare car parts.

loans.use: increase his shop’s inventory of mechanical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica  is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and operates a fishing boat, catching fish and crabs to sell in the market in town. She has been doing this for 10 years to earn a living. She borrowed a loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fishing materials. She hopes to have another fishing boat in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a flower-making business for the past five years. Shumaila offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events such as birthdays and parties etc. 

Shumaila sells the flowers to the people in her community and also supplies in the local market. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Shumaila is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good loan history. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to buy raw material such as fabric, glace and tissue paper, as well as packs of paint in various colors. 

In this way, Shumaila will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenue to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace and tissue paper, as well as packs of paint in various colors.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 40-year-old married woman actively running a 'Tandoor' in her house for many years. A tandoor (clay oven) is used for cooking chapattis and naan, specially in Pakistan. She cooks chapattis and naan with flour, salt and oil then sells them to her neighbors. She also takes orders from nearby hotels and makes enough money for a decent life. She is a loving mother of five children and is responsible for their food, health and education and trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase more sacks of flour with packs of salt and oil. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to provide good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of flour with packs of salt and oil.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 28-year-old hard-working married woman. She has been in the business of stitching clothes for the past three years. She is expert in designing clothes according to the demands of her customers, and she makes a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. Now she is also receiving some orders from a nearby boutique, but due to a lack of funds she is unable to complete the orders on time. For this reason, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads in various colors, along with some packs of laces, ribbons, zippers and buttons. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good loan history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy threads, laces, ribbons, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Benkaditon 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Benkaditon 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Faty (femme assise au milieu parmi les assises dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Massalawere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de petits équipements, des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women from the group called Benkaditon 3 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 45 and on average five children. They all live in the village of Massalawere in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They met through their rainy season agricultural activities and ties of neighborhood,  marriage and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. In order to buy small equipment and to stock up on farm inputs, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second cycle seasonal loan. 

Madame  Faty (the woman sitting in the photo in the middle of the row of seated women) works hard at her rainy season agricultural activities in the village of Massalawere.  She intends to use her loan to buy small equipment, seeds and fertilizer and also to pay young people to weed her field.  The sale of her agricultural produce takes place for cash at the end of the rainy season to repay her loan and in order to have income to cover children's expenses and a part of the family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 31-year-old married woman who works from her home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for twelve years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

Sumera's husband has a business selling ‘Naan’ but is unable to run the household alone. Therefore, Sumera felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working on her own. 

Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. So, Sumera requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to purchase reels of threads, packs of needles, buttons and zippers. 

With this loan, Sumera will be able to stitch up more dresses for her customers. Sumera hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase reels of threads, packs of needles, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Mumbo

texts.en:
Mumbo is a married woman with six children. Five of the children attend school while one is still young. Mumbo lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 11 years, she has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Bako

texts.en: Bako is 50 years old, married, and has two children. Being a responsible father, Bako works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs. He is dedicated to farming, growing potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards, he has been working hard from early morning till late evening for 27 years. Bako would like to develop his business, which is why he is applying for a loan in the amount of 6,500 TJS (Tajiki somoni) to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds to prepare for the new planting season.

loans.name: Benkaditon 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes de Benkaditon 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Djeneba (femme assise au bout à gauche  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Massalawere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de petits équipements, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven women from the group called Benkaditon 4 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 and on average four children. They all live in the village of Massalawere in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They met through their rainy season agricultural activities and ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.
